title: Addendum To “Enormous Nutshell”: Competing Selectors
summary:
Key ideas:
- Right-wing policies and systems are those selected by cultural evolution, while left-wing policies and systems are selected by the marketplace of ideas.
- Under this definition, fascism, communism, and liberalism are all left-wing ideas.
- Dictatorships may be more effective than democracies at implementing right-wing policies due to their ability to resist pressure from activists and the masses.
- Creating a system conducive to cultural evolution, with a patchwork of small countries ruled by absolute dictators, could be a way to guarantee that a collection of countries works well.

Key learnings:
- Humans are bad at designing effective institutions and organizations, so it's better to create "variation and selection systems" that allow alternative institutions or organizational forms to compete.
- Memetic evolution gets faster and faster, resulting in the spread of convincing-sounding but false ideas.
- Cultural evolution may be a counterweight to memetic evolution, and understanding its role can help increase its influence in case of emergency.

Key questions: 
- What prevents every democracy from instantly becoming maximally left-wing?
- Would dictatorships really be higher variance than democracies?
- Would cultural evolution at the international level work quickly enough to be humane?
- How can we raise the sanity waterline and make true things more convincing than false things?
